td.content: s:50 year old white M electrical engineer presents with injured rt hip due to having received blunt force trauma. he reports critical lack of feeling in right leg and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 70 in, Weight 200 lbs, Temperature 98.8 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 102, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 14, irreversibly demolished hip a:m aged 50 yrs presents with traumatic blunt injury to right hip p:administered dilaudid - 1 mg IV q 2-3h prn. May repeat if no relief in 30min, ancef - 1 gm IV q 8 hours, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and referred patient to orthopedics.

Term.SYMPTOM: Loss of capacity to feel emotions

Value.Value: E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,
orthopedics

td.content: s:male aged 50 Ys presents for follow-up on amputated right hip. patient indicates severe swelling at the amputation site and severe stump pain. o:Height 71 in, Weight 203 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 15, large wound, No bone visible in the wound at this time a:Disarticulation of right hip status p:performed Global postoperative visit - Completed, and prescribed vicodin HP 10-300 - 1 tab PO q 4 hours prn pain, ordered BMP, rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip, and referred patient to therapy, physical.

Value.Value: Global postoperative visit

content2.Value: Global postoperative visit
Complete

Value.Value: ordered BMP , rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip ,

content2.Value: ordered BMP , rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip ,

Value.Value: therapy , physical

content2.Value: therapy , physical

td.content: s:white male electrical engineer aged 50 Ys with 2 weeks old amputated rt hip presents for physical therapy visit. patient reports no issues o:, Extremity = no redness, no pus, good strength; Treatment provided: 1. Aerobic exercise to increase endurance 2. Hip extension, Hip abduction/adduction 3. mobility 4. Balance 5. Skin care a:Disarticulation of right hip status p:Start therapy sessions every three days until improvement in condition. performed Physical therapy evaluation - Completed; rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip - patient tolerated treatment well, showed increased ROM and strength.

content2.Unmatched: , no pus , good strength; Treatment provided:
Start therapy sessions every three days until improvement

Value.Value: Physical therapy evaluation - Completed; rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip - patient tolerated treatment well , showed increased ROM

content2.Value: Physical therapy evaluation - Completed; rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip - patient tolerated treatment well , showed increased ROM
